text: The beast lets out a low growl, the rocky armor along its limbs gleaming with a cold sheen. Its breath is heavy and scorching, as though it could crush the entire forest under its weight.
I force myself to stay calm. Instead of moving recklessly, I watch it carefully. It moves fast despite its weight—but each time it lands, its right foreleg hesitates for just a fraction of a second.
In that instant, I understand—that’s the weakness.
“Alicia! Its right leg—there’s a crack!” I shout.

She reacts immediately, pivoting in one fluid motion. Like a streak of silver, she drives her blade straight into the fracture. With a dull impact, the beast freezes, then collapses and dissolves into a wisp of green smoke.
I exhale deeply, my legs still trembling. Alicia slides her sword back into its sheath and scans the ground to ensure the creature is truly gone before turning back to me.
“That shout just saved me a lot of trouble.” There’s a hint of a smile in her voice. “Sharp eyes.”
“I… just got lucky.” I rub the back of my neck.
“Luck doesn’t point out cracks in armor.” She chuckles softly. “Next time you notice something like that, tell me sooner.”
A breeze sweeps through the trees, carrying away the lingering smoke. Alicia’s gaze falls to the scorched earth, her expression turning more solemn.
“These creatures aren’t natural,” she says quietly. “They’re ‘Lingering Dreams’—traces left behind by the dead.”
“Yes. In places where battles were fought and people died, their final emotions sink into the ground. Over time, they become things like this.”
She looks back at me, her voice gentler now. “You did well just now. Thank you.”
I smile sheepishly. “That’s because you taught me well.”
She laughs lightly. “I never taught you that.”
She extends her hand, and I take it instinctively—her palm still warm from the afterglow of battle.
“You’re surprisingly quick to get comfortable,” she teases. “Come on. The market’s just ahead.”
Alicia smiles again, the expression faint but bright—like sunlight slipping through leaves and settling quietly in the heart.
